content: I need help on upgrading my dd214 recode from 4 to one that will allow me to reenter the military. Also I was not properly represented while in the Navy and was falsy charged with and prosecuted with being UA for 72hrs.yet I pulled a security detail for that command during the alleged U.A.the Proof is in the Officer Of the Day log book For March 1996. How can I obtain that info from that book?

title: upgrading Dd214 and removing a false charge frome record

content: Sounds like you should have done that 13 years ago. That log book is probably packed away in a crate in some warehouse somewhere. If it even still exists. FYI, It is very rare to get your discharge upgraded. Good luck with that.

title: upgrading Dd214 and removing a false charge frome record

content: You can submit a FOIA request to the command to see if they maintain records back to 1996, or if they archive records somewhere. You will also have to petition the Board for the Correction of Naval Records, and possibly the Naval Discharge Review Board afterwards depending on the type of discharge (if other than honorable). "The World's Finest"
